page.title: 17Audenshaw Reservoirs.
page.content: The reservoirs are very popular in the summer.They attract sunbathers,besides those who like to swim.There is a golf club nearby. The reservoirs are over a hundred years old.In 1875 an Act of Parliament was passed to allow some reservoirs to be built at Audenshaw and Denton. Although five were planned only three were completed.In August 1883 they were filled with water.They could hold 1,413,488,434 gallons.The water came from reservoirs at Longdendale. Red Hall and some farms were covered by the water.Red Hall was built in 1672 by Ralph Stopford,who had been an officer in Cromwell's army.Its name came from its red brickwork.The reservoirs are regularly used by the local people for leisure. There are many canoes and sailing dingies.It is also a favourite haunt for walkers,joggers and fishermen.
